global_notes: Surface defined one baseline group (G1). All 53 executed rows belong to G1. No adjustment to baseline-group assignments was needed. The surface listed 'design/difference_in_differences/estimator/twfe' in core_universe.design_spec_ids but it was not executed as a standalone row; the TWFE design is captured inside the 'baseline' row's coefficient_vector_json design block. The 5 alt-outcome baseline rows (baseline__sport_hrs, baseline__oweight, baseline__kommheard, baseline__kommgotten, baseline__kommused) are explicitly listed in the surface's core_universe.baseline_spec_ids but measure different outcome concepts from the G1 focal claim (sportsclub membership). Per instructions, outcome-concept drift overrides to noncore_alt_outcome (is_core_test=0). The 3 sportsclub baseline rows (baseline, baseline__sportsclub_col1, baseline__sportsclub_col2) are core_method with is_core_test=1.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: ATT of C2SC sports club voucher program (Saxony, post-2008/09) on sports club membership (binary) for primary school children in Saxony vs Brandenburg/Thuringia, cohorts 2006-2010, estimated via TWFE with year, state, and city FEs, SEs clustered at city level.
baseline_groups.treatment_concept: C2SC sports club voucher program (treat: Saxony x post-2008 cohort)
baseline_groups.estimand_concept: ATT of voucher availability on sports club participation
baseline_groups.target_population: Primary school children in 3 German states (Saxony=treatment, Brandenburg and Thuringia=control), cohorts 2006-2010
baseline_groups.expected_sign: positive (voucher intended to increase club membership)
baseline_groups.notes: Table 2 Column 3 is the preferred specification (year + state + city FEs, no individual controls, clustered SE at city). Columns 1-2 are alternative FE structures for the same sportsclub outcome. Five additional baseline specs test alternative outcomes (sport_hrs, oweight, kommheard, kommgotten, kommused) from the paper's Table 2 and Table 3; these are classified noncore_alt_outcome. The baseline coefficient 0.0089 is small and statistically insignificant (p=0.635), consistent with the paper's null finding for the main outcome.
baseline_groups.surface_notes: All surface G1 baseline_spec_ids were executed (7 listed + 1 primary baseline row added by runner). The design/difference_in_differences/estimator/twfe spec_id in core_universe.design_spec_ids was not executed as a standalone row; no action required since it is redundant with the baseline row.
